result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Pullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Pullen

records.addlTxt: Order GRANTING request for extension, signed, filed and disbursed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. mag
Letter from defendant requesting a six-month extension on time to pay remaining balance of fine.  (Return Address:  Sean M. Pullen, 4303 N. 51st Blvd., Milwuakee, WI  53216).
Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Joe B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190405 in court 1x on 10/29/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Joe B. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, including the domestic violence assessment by 10/30/17 or, if not paid, entry of a civil judgment. Court advised the defendant that due to this domestic violence conviction, he may never posess a firearm.

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez. Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Branch 15 for branch 38. Continuation of court trial 10/28/15. In-chambers discussion held. Sworn for defense: Ofc. Jermel Wilder, MPD. Exhibit 1 received. State and defense rest. Testimony closed.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court found the defendant guilty and that this is a domestic violence situation. Case adjourned in branch 15.

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant signed a written waiver for jury trial.
Sworn for the State: Angela P. State rests. Defense motion to dismiss at the close of the State's case is denied.  Sworn for the Defense: Sean Pullen, defendant. Trial recessed for the day.

ADA Sarah McNutt appears for the state of Wisconsin.  Atty Ramon Valdez appears with the defendant.  Matter is set for jury trial today and the state is prepared to proceed with victim, citizen witness and police officer.  Defense is prepared to proceed.  Court will pass case to 1:15 to locate a possible spin court.
CASE RECALLED at 1:20pm  COURT REPORTER LORI ZAHN.
All parties are present in court.  The state advises that its witnesses are not present at this time and is requesting an adjournment.  Defense moves to dismiss.  The court will not adjourn and denies motion to dismiss.  A spin court has been located, Branch 15 Judge Watts.
State is now advised that its victim is nearby and will be appearing shortly.  Court spins case to Branch 15 Judge Watts FORTHWITH for jury.

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
File not in court.  
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
from victim, Angela P., received and filed.   mld

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Additional discovery is needed by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Court modified the no contact order that the parties may have contact by email ONLY regarding household financial matters and issues of child.  Parties are not allowed to discuss the case.   mld

Victim, Angela P., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court modified the no contact order that the parties may have contact by email ONLY regarding household financial matters and issues of child.  Parties are not allowed to discuss the case.  

Case called back on the record.  Victim wanted clarification regarding the defendant being able to attend the graduation services of their son, next week at Concordia University.  Parties may both attend the graduation services, but may not go together or have any contact.  mld

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-2-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court.  Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez unable to appear due to illness.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

03-31-15

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Angela P., and Joe B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sean M Pullen in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 04 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
